gurmukhi: ਪੁਨ ਰੀਝ ਦੲੇ ਦੋੳੂ ਤੀਅ ਬਰੰ || ਚਿਤ ਮੋ ਸੁ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਕਰੰ ||
transliteration: Poun Reejh Dae Dooo Teea Baran|| Chit Mo Su Bichaar Kachhodh Na Karan||
translation: The king was pleased and gave other two boons, he did not have any distrust in his mind.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੀ ਨਾਟਕ ਮੱਧ ਚਰਿਤ੍ਰ ਕਥਾ || ਜਯ ਦੀਨ ਸੁਰੇਸ ਨਰੇਸ ਜਥਾ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Kahinaatak Maddh Charitra Kathaa|| Jay Deen Sure Sdares Jathaa||17||
translation: How the king co-operated for the victory of Indra, the king of gods, this story has been told in the drama.17.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਿ ਜੀਤਿ ਅਨੇਕ ਅਨੇਕ ਬਿਧੰ || ਸਭ ਕਾਜ ਨਰੇਸ੍ਵਰ ਕੀਨ ਸਿਧੰ ||
transliteration: Ar(i) Jeet(i) Anek Anek Bidhan|| Sabh Kaaj Daresvar Keen Sidhan||
translation: The king fulfilled his heart’s desires by conquering many enemies.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਨ ਰੈਣ ਬਿਹਾਰਤ ਮੱਧਿ ਬਣੰ || ਜਲ ਲੈਨ ਦਿਜਾੲਿ ਤਹਾਂ ਸ੍ਵਣੰ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Din Rain Bihaarat Madhh(i) Banan|| Jal Lain Dijaae Tahaan Sravanan||18||
translation: He passed his time mostly in the forsrts. Once a Brahmin named Sharvan Kumar was roaming there in search of water.18.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਤ ਮਾਤ ਤਜੇ ਦੋੳੂ ਅੰਧ ਭੂਯੰ || ਗਹਿ ਪਾਤ੍ਰ ਚਲਿਯੋ ਜਲੁ ਲੈਨ ਸੁਯੰ ||
transliteration: Pit Maat Taje Dooo Andh Bhuyan|| Gad(i) Paatra Chaliyo Jal(u) Lain Suyan||
translation: Leaving his blind parents at some spot, the son had come for water, holding the pitcher in his hand.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨਿ ਨੋ ਦਿਤ ਕਾਲ ਸਿਧਾਰ ਤਹਾਂ || ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਬੈਠ ਪਤੳੂਵਨ ਬਾਂਧ ਜਹਾਂ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Mounndi) No Dit Kaal Sidhaar Tahaan|| Nrip Baith Paraoovan Baandh Jahaan||19||
translation: That Brahmin sage was sent there by death, where the king was rresting in a tent.19.

gurmukhi: ਭਭਕੰਤ ਘਟੰ ਅਤਿ ਨਾਦਿ ਹੁਅੰ || ਧੁਨਿ ਕਾਨ ਪਰੀ ਅਜ ਰਾਜਸੁਅੰ ||
transliteration: Bhabhkant Ghatan At(i) Naadh Huan|| Dhoun(i) Kaan Pariaj Raanjsuan||
translation: There was sound of filling the pitcher with water, which was heard by the king.

gurmukhi: ਗਹਿ ਪਾਣ ਸੁ ਬਾਣਹਿ ਤਾਨ ਧਨੰ || ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਜਾਣ ਦਿਜੰ ਸਰ ਸੁੱਧ ਹਨੰ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Gad(i) Paan Su Baanah(i) Taan Dhanan|| Mrig Jaan Dijan Sar Suddh Hanan||20||
translation: The king fitted the arrow in the bow and pulled it and considering the Brahmin as a deer, he shot the arrow on him and killed him.20.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰ ਗਯੋ ਸੁ ਲਗੇ ਸਰ ਸੁੱਧ ਮੁਨੰ || ਨਿਸਰੀ ਮੁਖ ਤੇ ਹਹਕਾਰ ਧੁਨੰ ||
transliteration: Gir Gyo Su Lage Sar Suddh Mounndng|| Nidarimoukh Te Hahkaar Dounan||
translation: On being struck by the arrow, the ascetic fell down and there was sound of lamentation from his mouth.

gurmukhi: ਮ੍ਰਿਗਨਾਤ ਕਹਾ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਜਾੲਿ ਲਹੈ || ਦਿਜ ਦੇਖ ਦੋੳੂ ਕਰ ਦਾਂਤ ਗਹੈ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Mrignaat Kahaa Nrip Jaae Lahai|| Dij Dekh Dooo Kar Daant Gadai||21||
translation: For seeing the spot, where the deer had died, the king went there, but on seeing that Brahmin, he pressed his finger under his teeth in distress.21.

gurmukhi: ਕਛੁ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਰਹੇ ਤਿਹ ਮੱਧ ਤਨੰ || ਨਿਕਰੰਤ ਕਹਾ ਜੀਅ ਬਿੱਪ ਨ੍ਰਿਪੰ ||
transliteration: Kachh(u) Praan Rahe Tih Maddh Tanan|| Nikrant Kahaa Jeea Bipp Nripan||
translation: There were still some life-breath in the body of Shravan. In his final life-breaths, the Brahmin said to the kind:

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰ ਤਾਤਰੁ ਮਾਤ ਨ੍ਰਿਚੱਛ ਪਰੇ || ਤਿਹ ਪਾਨ ਪਿਅਾੲਿ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਾਪ ਮਰੇ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Mur Taatar(u) Maat Nrichachchh Dare|| Tih Paan Piaae Nripaadh Dare||22||
translation: “My mother and father are blind and are lying on that side. You go there and make them drink water, so that I may die peacefully.”22.
